statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Xavier 68, Miami 53
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Stanley Burrell scored 15 points and Xavier had its best shooting night of the season in a 68-53 win over Miami (Ohio) Wednesday night. Drew Lavender added 13 points for the Musketeers (5-1), who've won two straight after losing to then-No. 8 Alabama on Nov. 20. Xavier shot about 55 percent (24-for-44) from the field to set a season-high for the second consecutive game. Its previous season-high was 51 percent (25-for-49) Saturday in an 86-68 win over American. Burrell has reached double figures in five of Xavier's six games this season. Nathan Peavy had 18 points and 11 rebounds for RedHawks (3-4). Tim Pollitz added 15 and Michael Bramos 11 for Miami, who made just 2-of-20 3-pointers and suffered its worst loss of the season. Miami lost by 11 at Kentucky on Nov. 15. The Musketeers never trailed. The teams combined to make their first nine shots of the game, but three of Xavier's were 3-pointers as the Musketeers opened up a 15-8 lead with 15:52 left in the first half. The Musketeers made 5-of-12 3-pointers in the first half while building a 35-26 halftime lead. Miami was 0-for-8 on 3-pointers, including Doug Penno's 0-for-5. Peavy sank a pull-up jumper in the lane to cut Xavier's lead to 52-46 with 8:42 left in the game before Xavier pulled away.
